abstract: The Upshot; government actuaries project that national spending on health care will grow at annual rate of 5.8 percent through 2024, significant increase from 4 percent annual growth measured between 2007 and 2013; health spending slowed during Great Recession, and it remains unclear whether it will return to traditional 9 percent annual growth rate once newly-insured are absorbed into system.
lead_paragraph: The big question is whether health spending will reset to the slow rate of recent years or return to the long-term pattern of high growth.

headline.main: Health Spending Forecast: No Drastic Rise, but Slowdown Seems Over
headline.print_headline: Health Spending Is Expected to Rise as Slowdown Ends

snippet: The big question is whether health spending will reset to the slow rate of recent years or return to the long-term pattern of high growth.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
